dialog: If thou dost not turn in the Continued Claim Form every fortnight, we cannot remunerate thee.
Can it still be sent by post if it be more than fourteen days late?
If it be no more than two weeks past due, we shall still accept it.
I shall make certain to send it sooner next time so as to avoid such issues.
Thou canst not predict thy work schedule in advance. If thou sendeth it too soon, it shall be rejected!
Shall my wages arrive belatedly due to my error in the form?
Thy pay shall arrive late, but the next shall arrive promptly.
I must inform thee that I shall be departing in thirty minutes' time.
I am prepared when thou art, sir.
Excellent! The clock hath just struck nine in New York.
Thou art correct, sir. Just now it hath become nine o'clock.
I shall spend some time exploring the city. What should I do with my baggage?
Here, sir, we have a storage site for thy belongings at the cost of five galleons per hour, but a deposit is required.
A deposit? Are my belongings not enough of a deposit?
Apologies, sir, but they are not. Thy MasterCard or VISA shall suffice.
Very well. I shall consider it.
Very well, sir, but tarry not too long. Thou hast but thirty minutes.
May I take thy order?
Aye, I would like a bowl of onion soup, if thou please.
And what would thou like after that?
